captions.text:
Thanks so much for coming
out to this meeting.

Sarah, if you wouldn't mind
taking notes, that'd be great.
- Oh, um, just doodle, you know.
There is some company policy changes...
Goodbye, robot with a dog head.

Will you sign Greg's
birthday card really quickly?
Wait. What are you doing? Drawing?
- Just give me one minute. It'll be done.
- Alright, I think that covers it.
- Sarah, can I get those notes, please?

title: Problems Only People Who Doodle Understand

comments.text:
I hate it when people are looking through my sketchbook and they start to 
draw something on another sheet of paper, and then I realize that person is 
copying exactly what I drew and claiming it as their own. Nothing I hate 
more!﻿
comments.author: Haley Puckett

comments.text:
omg ikr!!! Every day no matter how much time it might take I must ALWAYS 
draw or I will curl up in a tiny ball, find the nearest cliff, and THROW 
myself down to the rocks where I will face my doom. Also, sometimes in 
school I know that it will probably affect my grades but I just draw 
instead of learning or doing my work, but I have to bring my big pink diary 
to school so I can't risk the teachers catching me so I have to be SUPER 
careful. Or other times, i'm in music class and I can't bring my diary with 
me so I search my folder, look for a piece of blank paper and draw whatever 
I can on it! Also, if I don't have to turn it in, whenever the teacher 
hands the class work to do I always sketch a little comic on it or anything 
I want! ERMERGERSH and you KNOW what it's going to be like when you have 
art class. So your just minding your own business like a normal human being 
when someone comes up to you and says, "WHAT U DRAWING IM A STALKER AND I 
WOULD LIKE TO KNOW!!! :D!!!" I mean seriously, I know your interested just 
a little bit but I'm trying to do my own thing here. It also burns SO 
BAD!!! when your drawing or writing something extremely personal instead of 
working, when all of a sudden the teacher says, "Okay time to turn your 
work into me just to let you know I will scan every bit of it and if you 
have something abnormal on your paper I will come up to you, show it to the 
whole class, read it out loud, and give you an F. No pressure guys!" 
BLEAHH!!!!!!!!!!!! One time when I had finished my work, I flipped my paper 
over to the back and wrote about how awful one of my psychopathic 
classmates are, how they literally tell people to commit suicide, scream at 
them, punch them, and stab them with their pencil while the teachers see 
this perfectly well, and see how kind he is bringing death and pain to 
everyone. My teacher looked at mine, and was like, "Who's is this?!" And 
everyone in the class says, "IT WAS HERS J#KNJ$BFJKHFIJRIO#LRIO#HFKJ!!!!!!" 
And so all the attention is on me now and I am just dying right in the 
center of the class wishing that I could shoot myself in the head or throw 
myself out the window. AHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I know this is really long, but I can't keep in a lot of things :p﻿
comments.author: Jessica Love

comments.text:
aaand the "omg draw something for me/draw me/can i have this" or "why don't

anxious...﻿

So it was the last day of being at this school, this girl comes up to me. 
"Draw me something! :DD" And so I draw her three pictures , one being an 
anthro cat. One being some dolls and another being a pony. And my teacher 
kept yelling at me ;; when I got done with them I gave it to her and she 
says "um? Its good.....??? Can you please re-draw it?" And I swear to 
fucking god I wanted to kill her.﻿

comments.text:
When doodling people always ask, "WHAT DOES IT MEAN?!?!"
It doesn't mean anything. That's why it's doodling. Sometimes it does mean 
something but it's only the person who drew it's business. Today I was 
doodling a girl with dragon wings and people were like "YOU'RE SOOOO 
ARTISTIC!!" I say, "Not really." In my head I'm like, "It's just a !?$&ing 
doodle!"﻿

comments.author: Lizanne Van Wyk

comments.text:
I hate it when everyone asks you questions about who/what you're drawing.
If you are drawing a person, they ALWAYS ask if its you, or can you draw 
them, or why you are drawing. Oh, and don't let me forget, they ask you if 
you drew it.. WELL OF COURSE I DREW IT!! WHY WOULD I HAVE IT THEN??
Then when you're drawing something, they ask you what it is. I always 
answer 'I don't know' because Im just drawing what I come up with. Then 
they ask you if you're finished. If they can see you moving your pencil, 
and still making marks on the paper, then Im pretty sure they still haven't 
finished it..﻿
comments.author: TheMagicalUnicorn - Maja

comments.text: Lol I doodle all over school work... Don't judge, it helps me.﻿
comments.author: Pure Fun and Stopmotions

comments.text:
i used to doodle alot back when i was in school... it was a fun way to 
forget about all the bad parts about being in a room full of people that 
couldnt care less for you. but oh of course, someone had to destroy that 
too... at one point, my entire folder was COVERED in little drawings, 
sayings, quotes... it looked like one of those people that are tattoowed 
from head to toe... ii still have it becaue of that, but one day i got back 
from the lunch break and saw that some probably very intelligent and 
valuable person had written "SATAN" and "EMO" like a hundred times all over 
the folder. non of wich were reasonable... i mean, i never had any kind of 
styling that could be considered... ANYTHING... simple, short, brown 
hair... casual every day clothing... so wtf? O_o﻿
